data_facts_with_para.paragraph: While the Tesla Model Y and Model 3 have been the two best-selling models in the United States since 2020, the 110 new models that have entered the market since then have driven the market share of Tesla down from 60% in 2020 to 38% in 2024. Furthermore, 2024 was the first year in which Tesla saw a drop in sales in the United States, while other OEMs saw sales increase by 20% on aggregate.

facts.fact_content: Tesla's market share decreased from 60% in 2020 to 38% in 2024.
110 new models entered the market since 2020.
Other OEMs saw sales increase by 20% on aggregate in 2024.
